title: Neutral Position Adaption

body.body: The neutral position adaption is required to allow for manufacturing tolerances of the gearbox and gear position sensor. The motorcycle is delivered from the factory with the neutral position fully adapted.
The neutral position adaption must be reset and re-adapted under the conditions that follow:
If a gear position sensor malfunction occurs (DTC P0914 and P0917, see
The gear position sensor has been removed or disconnected for any reason.
The Gear Position/Neutral Position Adaption Reset function provided in the Triumph diagnostic tool will erase all previous Gear Position/Neutral Position Adaptions.
To reset the Neutral Position adaptions:
Connect the Triumph diagnostic tool and turn the ignition ON.
Check and erase all stored DTCs.
Select ADJUST TUNE then select Gear Position/Neutral Position Adaption Reset.
The software will confirm that the adaption has been successfully reset.
The neutral position will now be reported as Not Adapted.
Never start the engine or run the engine in a confined area.
Always operate the motorcycle in the open air or in an area with adequate ventilation.
Exhaust fumes are poisonous and will cause loss of consciousness and death within a short period of time.
Make sure that the transmission is in neutral.
For successful and accurate adaption, The engine must be at normal idle speed and the gear change pedal must be in its normal rested position.
During adaption, do not raise the engine speed and do not touch or move the gear change pedal.
If the conditions above are met, the neutral position will adapt soon after the engine is started.
Select GEAR POSITION ADAPTION STATUS on the Triumph diagnostic tool to confirm the adaption status.
Turn the ignition OFF for at least 60 seconds to allow the adaption settings to be stored in ECM memory.

Adaption Reset
The Gear Position/Neutral Position Adaption Reset function provided in the Triumph diagnostic tool will erase all previous Gear Position/Neutral Position Adaptions.
To reset the Neutral Position adaptions:
Connect the Triumph diagnostic tool and turn the ignition ON.
Select ENGINE DIAGNOSTICS.
Check and erase all stored DTCs.
Select ADJUST TUNE then select Gear Position/Neutral Position Adaption Reset.
Click Start.
The software will confirm that the adaption has been successfully reset.
The neutral position will now be reported as Not Adapted.
Re-Adaption
Never start the engine or run the engine in a confined area.
Always operate the motorcycle in the open air or in an area with adequate ventilation.
Exhaust fumes are poisonous and will cause loss of consciousness and death within a short period of time.
To re-adapt the neutral position:
Make sure that the transmission is in neutral.
Start the engine.
For successful and accurate adaption, The engine must be at normal idle speed and the gear change pedal must be in its normal rested position.
During adaption, do not raise the engine speed and do not touch or move the gear change pedal.
If the conditions above are met, the neutral position will adapt soon after the engine is started.
Select GEAR POSITION ADAPTION STATUS on the Triumph diagnostic tool to confirm the adaption status.
Turn the ignition OFF for at least 60 seconds to allow the adaption settings to be stored in ECM memory.
